problems.title: Vacuum Won't Turn On or Start
problems.description: Diagnosing why your Bissell ProHeat not heating won't power on.
possible_causes: Battery is dead and needs replacement
solution_steps: Charge the vacuum for at least 4 hours
Look for any error lights or beeps
If completely dead, battery replacement is likely needed

required_parts.name: Bissell ProHeat not heating Diagnostic Tool

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a Bissell ProHeat not heating?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $386 vacuum, and extending the life of your Bissell is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Bissell ProHeat not heating needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include reduced performance and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my Bissell ProHeat not heating myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
